content:
This internship will focus primarily on providing support to our finance team, mainly focusing on assisting with posting journal entries, bank statement reconciliation, annual audits, and other ad-hoc financial reporting and analysis. It is an ongoing internship, that will begin immediately and continue throughout the year. We are looking for a commitment of at least 25 hours per week both over the summer and during the school year. If you are driven, highly organized, great with interpersonal communication, and a meticulous worker looking to gain experience in a positive & team-based environment, then this is a great opportunity for you!
The intern would be reporting to the Finance team and would be supporting them in whichever tasks needed to be completed.
What You’ll Do:

Banks reconciliation for our US and international entities.
Assists in month-end closing.
Prepares accounting adjustments.
Updates schedules to control/monitor G/L movement.
Assists with accounts payable tasks such as processing invoices, setting up vendors, and preparing A/P reports.
Assists with issuing tax notices (1099’s) to advisors as required.
Performs ad-hoc accounting tasks on an as-needed basis.

What You Have:

Must be enrolled in a college or university in New York and or be able to commute to New York once a week 
Minimum GPA 3.5
Undergraduate Accounting majors
Students entering their junior or senior year of college highly preferred
Excellent communication, analytical and organizational skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word

 What We Have:
The base pay for this position is $25.00 per hour.

Free snacks and beverages
Friday happy hour and “Summer Fridays”
Casual work environment
Hybrid work environment

About Guidepoint:
 
Guidepoint is a leading research enablement platform designed to advance understanding and empower our clients’ decision-making process. Powered by innovative technology, real-time data, and hard-to-source expertise, we help our clients to turn answers into action. 
Backed by a network of nearly 1.5 million experts, and Guidepoint’s 1,300 employees worldwide, we inform leading organizations’ research by delivering on-demand intelligence and research on request. With Guidepoint, companies and investors can better navigate the abundance of information available today, making it both more useful and more powerful.
